title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 February 2016 - XWiki
content:
<tmortagne> has quit  
00:41 <abusenius> has quit  
06:37 <cjd> has quit  
07:28 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
07:28 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:47 <cjd> has quit  
08:07 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:15 <sorinello> has quit  
08:15 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
08:42 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
09:41 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:16 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:29 <vmassol> Enygma`: wrong url I think in the blog post  
10:29 <vmassol> 11 bugs points to http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=13596  
10:29 <vmassol> points to dashboard of 18 February 2016  
10:30 <vmassol> I hope my last issue I closed this morning counts too!  
10:30 <vmassol> (since i spent 90% of my time yetsteday)  
10:30 <vmassol> I mean 90% of the time I spent on it was done yesterday ;)  
10:32 <Enygma`> vmassol: thanks, fixed  
10:33 <Enygma`> ah, 12  
10:33 <Enygma`> you`ve just closed it in the past 20 minutes, vmassol?  
10:33 <vmassol> yep  
10:35 <tmortagne> Enygma`: in case you did you saw it: "Rule violated for bundle XWiki Platform - Localization - API: instructions covered ratio is 0.03, but expected minimum is 0.04"  
10:36 <Enygma`> tmortagne: yep, on display-api too, on 7.4.2... will fix it, thanks  
10:39 <Enygma`> vmassol:  fixed  
10:39 <vmassol> thanks  
10:40 <vmassol> what one would do to have one more BFD :)  
10:40 <Enygma`> also noticing an attachment related bug: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Blog/Bug+Fixing+Day+93/bfd93.png  
10:40 <Enygma`> that attachment no longer exists in the page  
10:41 <vmassol> one more BFD is important  
10:41 <vmassol> especially since it makes me win over thomas :)  
10:41 <vmassol> see http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=10352#Pie-Chart/13614  
10:41 <vmassol> (by one bug!)  
10:41 <vmassol> I'm still the leader!!! yeah :)  
10:42 <evalica> :) I fixed yesterday 2 improvements …… damn it :p  
10:42 <evalica> yes you are vincent :)  
10:42 <vmassol> come on Enygma`, evalica is beating you, you should react!  
10:42 <vmassol> 150 over 119  
10:43 <evalica> I'm happy that he fixed my 7.4.2 bug so I think is fair :P  
10:43 <vmassol> :)  
10:43 <vmassol> and GD is not far behind you Enygma` :)  
10:44 <vmassol> Caty is the master at finding duplicates ;)  
10:44 <Enygma`> it`s not all in the quantity ;)  
10:44 <vmassol> hehe  
10:46 <evalica> :)  
11:00 <amack2> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <spawn57> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <spawn57> Hi  
11:09 <spawn57> I find that if you rename a page and the page name contains / or \, it breaks the links to the page  
11:09 <spawn57> same with + characters  
11:12 <vmassol> spawn57: you're on tomcat?  
11:12 <vmassol> if so you need to read http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationTomcat#HAllowing222F22inpagenames  
11:13 <spawn57> yup, tomcat  
11:14 <spawn57> ahhh  
11:14 <vmassol> evalica: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13096# is now fixed  
11:14 <spawn57> thanks vmassol  
11:14 <vmassol> np  
11:15 <spawn57> have a good weekend  
11:15 <spawn57> ttyl  
11:15 <vmassol> u2  
11:15 <spawn57> has quit  
15:10 <msmeria> has quit  
16:37 <Pbas> has quit  
16:55 <Denis> I will restart xwiki.org soon to upgrade the scripting documentation…  
16:56 <vmassol> Denis: why do you need to restart?  
16:56 <Denis> because of a jar upgrade  
16:56 <vmassol> ah yes that bug  
16:57 <vmassol> works on myxwiki but not xwiki.org indeed  
17:00 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
17:01 <HillHobbit> has joined #xwiki  
17:03 <evalica> amack2: comment on the issue where the commit was accepted and see if the change can be ported to 7.3.x. Or you will need to upgrade to 7.4.x when it's released (probably on Monday)  
17:04 <vmassol> amack2: we really don't recommend running 7.3.x  
17:04 <vmassol> it's not a good release with several problems  
17:04 <vmassol> I'd recommend you use 7.4.1 at least and as Caty mentioned 7.4.2 will be release early next week  
17:04 <amack2> evalica: thanks vmassol: yes, upgrading to 7.4.x
